section.heading: Recovery by persons other than illegal drug users

content.p: A parent, legal guardian, child, or spouse of an individual drug\nuser;\n
An employer of an individual drug user; and\n

A medical facility, insurer, governmental entity, employer, or
other entity that funds a drug treatment program or employee assistance
program for the individual drug user.
 2. A person entitled to bring an action pursuant to subdivision one of
this section may be awarded damages from a person who knowingly
participated in the chain of distribution of an illegal drug actually
used by the individual drug user.
 3. A person knowingly participates in a drug market if:
the place of the illegal drug use by the individual drug user is\nwithin a drug market target community of the defendant;\n

the participation of the defendant in such drug market was
connected with the same type of illegal drug used by the individual
user; and

the defendant participated in such drug market at any time during
the illegal drug use by the individual user.
 4. A person entitled to bring an action under this section may recover
the following damages:
Reasonable expert consultant and expert witness fees; and\n
Costs and disbursements as provided for in the civil practice law\nand rules.\n
